A

addClientMessage(ClientMessageToServer<?>) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Adds a message to the queue for later processing, unless a known context object has been registered for this object in SwiftSocketServer.executionContexts.

B

broadcastMessage(ServerMessageToClient) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
 
broadcastMessage(ServerMessageToClient) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Send a message to all connected clients ignoring the client context in the message, by delegating this call to SwiftSocketServer.broadcastMessage(ServerMessageToClient).

C

ClientContext - Class in org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Contains all session data concerning a given client.
ClientContext(ClientEndpoint) - Constructor for class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientContext
Stores the given client endpoint and saves its InetAddress for later use (in case the endpoint is being closed and we lose the ability the query for the InetAddress).
ClientHandler - Class in org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Worker thread for the server that is dedicated to a single client.

Constructor, which accepts a SwiftSocketServer instance and a client ClientContext.
ClientMessageToServer<Controller> - Class in org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Defines a base for decodable and executable message types.
ClientMessageToServer(ClientContext) - Constructor for class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientMessageToServer
Constructor; simply stores a reference to the client associated with this message.
clientSaysByeBye() - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientHandler
Called by ClientMessageToServerByeBye.execute(ClientHandler).
countNext(StringBuilder) - Static method in class org.codemonkey.util.DecoderUtil
Returns the encoded length of the next token and removes this indication so that the encoded string starts with the token for further processing.

D

Interface for marking objects as datagram decoders.
DatagramEncoder - Interface in org.codemonkey.util
Interface for marking objects encodable as datagram.
decode(String) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientMessageToServer

decode(StringBuilder) - Method in interface org.codemonkey.util.DatagramDecoder
Populates the current implementation instance fields with values decoded from the given string (binary packet / datagram) of the current server response.
DecoderUtil - Class in org.codemonkey.util
Helper utility for interpreting encoded strings, including complete reflective decoding of objects.

defaultSleep() - Static method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ServerUtil
Performs a Thread.sleep(long) of 10 milliseconds.
deserialize(String) - Method in interface org.codemonkey.util.SimpleSerialization
The general contract of deserialize is:
Instance T a equals T b where b = new T().deserialize(a.serialize()).
disposeOfClient(ClientContext) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Removes a ClientContext and associated ClientHandler from the list of known clients.

extractValue(StringBuilder) - Static method in class org.codemonkey.util.DecoderUtil
Shortcut method that calls DecoderUtil.extractValues(StringBuilder, int) with argument of 1 and returns the first (and only) result value.
extractValues(StringBuilder, int) - Static method in class org.codemonkey.util.DecoderUtil
Extracts a given number of values from the datagram and returns the remaining encoded values.

M

MESSAGEID_LENGTH - Static variable in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientHandler

O

org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver - package org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Provides the classes to create a TCP / UDP socket server that communicates using custom serialized Java messages objects.
org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver - package org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver
Provides the classes to create a World Server, an extension of the Request Socket Server.
org.codemonkey.util - package org.codemonkey.util
Provides functional neutral utility classes.

P

pong() - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientHandler
Invoked by ClientMessageToServerPingPong.execute(ClientHandler), when the client is responding with a pong notification.

R

reflectiveDecode(Object, StringBuilder, Class<?>) - Static method in class org.codemonkey.util.DecoderUtil
Decodes a datagram reflectively by inspecting the given Class for all it fields, which are assumed to take part in the decoding process.
reflectiveEncode(Object, Class<?>) - Static method in class org.codemonkey.util.EncoderUtil
Reflectively resolves all fields on the subject which have a getter method of any type of visibility.

run() - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientHandler
Thread method that runs ping messages to the client and tests for timeouts.

S

sendMessage(ServerMessageToClient) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientHandler
Logs and sends a response message to the current client using ClientHandler.clientContext, delegating the actual sending to ClientHandler.sendMessage(ClientContext, int, ServerMessageToClient), unless the client has said 'Bye Bye' in which case the message to be sent is ignored altogether.
sendMessage(ServerMessageToClient) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Finds the right client handler based on the message's client context and sends the message to it.
sendMessage(ServerMessageToClient) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Sends a message to the client context stored in the message by delegating this call to SwiftSocketServer.sendMessage(ServerMessageToClient).
serialize() - Method in interface org.codemonkey.util.SimpleSerialization
Makes the object convert itself to a string representation.
ServerMessageToClient - Class in org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Provides a default DatagramEncoder implementation that returns an empty string.
ServerMessageToClient(ClientContext) - Constructor for class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ServerMessageToClient
Constructor; simply stores a reference to the client associated with this message.
ServerType - Enum in org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Defines the type of server, ServerType.UDP or ServerType.TCP.
ServerUtil - Class in org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Helper class mainly to hide some boilerplate code concerning Thread.sleep(long).
setFramesPerSecond(double) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Changes how often the server invokes WorldContext.updateWorld(double) and how big the delta factor is (by recalculating seconds-per-frame).
setPingPongMode(boolean) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Sets PingPong mode, use to poll clients for time-outs.
setPingPongMode(boolean, int, int) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Sets PingPong mode, use to poll clients for time-outs.
setPingPongMode(boolean) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Delegates to SwiftSocketServer.setPingPongMode(boolean).
setPingPongMode(boolean, int, int) - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Delegates to SwiftSocketServer.setPingPongMode(boolean, int, int).
SimpleSerialization<T> - Interface in org.codemonkey.util
Guarantees an object can produce and populate itself with a string value, not unlike deserialization.
sleep(int) - Static method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ServerUtil
Makes the current Thread sleep any number of milliseconds.
start() - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Thread safe method that starts the client thread, listening for new messages and sending messages.
start() - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Calls WorldContext.initWorld() before starting the server, after which the server starts handling client connections, incoming messages and world updates.
stop() - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Thread safe method to make the server initialize stopping procedure.
stop() - Method in class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Stops the Swift Socket Server by delegating this call to SwiftSocketServer.stop().
SwiftSocketServer - Class in org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
A low level message server that mediates messages from and to clients and the server in the form of 'datagrams' (custom serialized messages identified by a unique signature).
SwiftSocketServer(int) - Constructor for class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Default constructor, calls SwiftSocketServer.SwiftSocketServer(int, ServerType) with TCP ServerType.
SwiftSocketServer(int, ServerType) - Constructor for class org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.SwiftSocketServer
Creates a swift socket server and registers a couple of basic message types (message invalid, 'Ping Pong' and 'Bye Bye').

updateWorld(double) - Method in interface org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldContext

W

WorldContext - Interface in org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver
Client messages are executed against a WorldContext implementation allowing those messages to invoke world specific methods (ie.
WorldServer<T extends WorldContext> - Class in org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver
The World Server class adds a thin layer around the SwiftSocketServer to ease the management of a world state, or simulation / game state.
WorldServer(int, T, double) - Constructor for class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Starts a new default TCP swift socket server on the given port, performing updates based on the given frame per second.
WorldServer(int, T, double, ServerType) - Constructor for class org.codemonkey.swiftworldserver.WorldServer
Starts a new swift socket server of a specific type (TCP / UDP) on the given port, performing updates based on the given frame per second.
